text: "What's Love Got to Do with It" is the second single released in May 1984. It is from Tina Turner's album, Private Dancer. The song is a pop rock and soul song written by Graham Lyle and Terry Britten. Britten produced the song. It became Turner's most successful song. It reached number one on the Billboard Hot 100 in the US, in Australia, and the top five in New Zealand, Austria, Sweden, and the United Kingdom. The title of this song was used for a 1993 biographical movie that was distributed by TriStar Pictures. A remix of the song was released on July 17, 2020 by Norwegian DJ Kygo. ==Charts== ===Weekly charts=== Chart (1984) Peak position Australia (Kent Music Report) 1 Canada (The Record) 1 Europe (European Top 100) 9 Finland (Suomen virallinen lista) 26 South Africa (Springbok Radio) 2 Spain (PROMUSICAE) 6 US Hot Dance Club Songs (Billboard) 21 US Hot R&B;/Hip-Hop Songs (Billboard) 2 ===Year-end charts=== Chart (1984) Position Australia (Kent Music Report) 22 Canada Top Singles (RPM) 3 Germany (Official German Charts) 35 New Zealand (Recorded Music NZ) 13 Netherlands (Single Top 100) 76 UK Singles (Official Charts Company) 20 US Billboard Hot 100 2 US Adult Contemporary (Billboard) 50 US Hot R&B;/Hip-Hop Songs (Billboard) 3 Chart (1985) Position South Africa (Springbok Radio) 14 ===Decade-end charts=== Chart (1980–1989) Position US Billboard Hot 100 20 ===All-time charts=== Chart (1958–2018) Position US Billboard Hot 100 495 ==References== Category:1984 songs Category:Grammy Award-winning songs Category:Tina Turner songs Category:Cliff Richard songs Category:Kygo songs
